channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Wheelie bins left on street, 16th September
item.description:
Two wheelie bins outside 40 Morpeth Road, constantly left on street obstructing pavement, causing public nuisance. Left out for several months.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Morpeth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog barking constantly, and left outside all the time alone, 16th September
item.description:
A dog has been left in the garden of 136/136a Brooke Road. It’s alone all day and night, it barks constantly whenever anyone passes by. I’m worried about its safety and quality of life. The noise of the barking is very disruptive for neighbours too.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norcott Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Pedestrian button for traffic light not working, 16th September
item.description:
The pedestrian traffic lights button closest to sainsburys is non functional (for about 2 weeks). All other buttons seem to work. What I noticed is that if this button is pressed it does not make the lights go green after a full cycle of traffic has gone through. And fhe lights on the box containing the button do not light up after the button is pressed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2a, Brondesbury Road, Queen's Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree previously reported at this location now removed, although has merely been sawn up with a large amount left in River Bourne, 16th September
item.description:
Tree previously reported at this location now removed, although has merely been sawn up and left in adjacent undergrowth. A large amount still remains in River Bourne (although unfortunately doesn’t flow at this point as would appear to primarily feed Rookery Lake from slightly further upstream.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A21, Bromley Common, London

item.title: Too many bicycles at Corner of Waverly place, 16th September
item.description:
Today there must have been at least 30 bikes in the equivalent of a two car parking space at the corner of Waverly Place. They are not only a hazard for normal straight driving but are also not parked the entire way into the space and take up more than the allotted space. There were a mixture of lime and forest bikes stop I witnessed a worker have to exit his Westminster rubbish truck to move the bicycles to come down the street. They’re in a very dangerous and hazardous place as often you cannot turn the corner to go in or out of that street. I suggest they should be parked over by the tube station. It would be a lot safer for everyone because it’s always congested people and children crossing there and car drivers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Waverley Place, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Top of wall nearly falling off onto path outside primary school, 16th September
item.description:
As t can see from the pictures a tweet is growing through a wall and posing the top of it so that's going to fall off soon. This is next to a path and when it does tell it could kill someone. It's outside a school and a busy path for families and people going to Woolwich Dockyard station, going to the church and dropping kids off at school. I spoke to someone at the school and they've repeatedly reported it to the council. I wrote to MP and heard nothing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Borgard Road, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Constant fly tipping, 16th September
item.description:
The two blocks at the front are constantly relying on our paid service charges to continue fly tipping. I witnessed one of the children in a dressing gown on Sunday morning bring out drawers from a chest of drawers and dump them. Other neighbours from our block have also found boxes dumped with the full addresses and names clearly showing further evidence it is coming from them. As mentioned before this significantly impacts our service charges and isn’t fair that we get penalised for their dumping as they do not get fined or pay towards the charges. L&Q are aware but nothing is being done to deter them. Surely a letter can be circulated from yourselves warning of fines. Please advise.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
